author: Tevo
title: Distributed decision making Dapp
description: There are no tools to assist decision making already built on Cardano which could expand outside the community as well

assessments.note: The proposal appears to address the challenge criteria and details how this will occur during development stages. I would like to see further examples provided.
The documentation included in the Miro board helps complete the picture of what they intend to deliver. A series of smart contracts around effectively completing a voting round.

I can see how an app that keeps track of a decision process can profit from the bockchain technology. If decisions of individuals are conserved in the blockchain, it is easy to track the process of an distributed decision process. The application might also be attractive to a wide audience. My only doubts are the costs of transactions on the block-chain that might make the whole decision process simly to expensive.

This proposal does not effectively address the challenge with no reference to past projects, technical docs or detailed development roadmap. The proposer also does not make it clear if the project will be built in Solidity or Cardano's native smart contract language Plutus.

This proposal provides none of the technical documentation or detailed project plan a dapp requires to be fully reviewed (Technical docs or Whitepaper both non-existent). The author mentions WP as step 1 but for the amount requested it should be the 1st thing listed in the proposal.

It was difficult to understand the definition of the problem you're trying to solve and your value proposition for solving the problem. The project title and problem statement are focused on distributed decision making, but the detailed explanation of the approach is about how developers can make Cardano more appealing to users and increase community involvement. It wasn't clear to me what is the connection between this idea and distributed decision making.
The proposal is well structured and this gives me some indication the team has the experience to drive the proposal forward. I would have liked a little more information about the team.

Beyond the relevant experience line the proposer provides little detail to make it clear how the project will be implemented. Not at al clear if this will be developed in solidity or plutus, for example.

The proposal lacks a detailed project plan, benchmark to existing voting dApps, links to the author's previous voting dapps mentioned, or basic technical documentation required to describe the protocol in detail.

This proposal has an excellent project plan: it shows very clearly how the funds will be used, the different roles and number of team members required, and amount of time expected from each team member. Your Github repository and Bchainify website also show that your team has a headstart on this project.
Reasonable information is provided and a solid timeline is evident. Perhaps a little more specific use cases would have assisted my understanding of the proposal a little better.
The miro board clearly showcases an effective delivery and evaluation strategy.
Good description in general. I think that a web-application is planned for the application. This information is missing.
The proposal provides lacking detail and it fails to make it clear why this dApp is even needed as an extension of the already existing Catalyst Governance process.
This proposal is early in the idea stage and is still missing much of the documentation required to be considered complete

The detailed project plan you provided demonstrates that this project is feasible to achieve. However, since the problem you're trying to solve was not elaborated in sufficient detail and had conflicting explanations, it's difficult to determine how success will be measured. Will this be measured through increased adoption of Cardano and increased community involvement, or through improved decision making? I think there's a risk that you might create a great product that one will use. You clearly demonstrated strong technical and project management capabilities, but I recommend elaborating on the business proposition (or value proposition) of the product or service that you're planning to build and why would the community use your products and/or services instead of comparable solutions from other teams.

solution:
Creating open-source governance tools and proving documentation
A permanent mark on Cardano blockchain to share the plans and decisions
experience:
Created voting dapps w/ Solidity, Hyperledger, and Solana tools.
Team Leader, Project Manager, Front-end Developer, 2 Back-end Developers
